alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the main area of thunderstorms is moving north of the area. Although the risk for additional flooding is diminishing, many areas remain flooded where as much as 3 to 5 inches of rain fell earlier in the afternoon, especially in parts of North Charleston, including the Park Circle Area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Daniel Island, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Don Holt Bridge, Charleston Naval Complex, Charleston Airport, Magnolia Gardens, Park Circle, Riverfront Park, Midland Park, Westmoreland Bridge, Red Bank Landing, Beresford and Lambs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
